cont.entity_b: Lacks firmware updates for modern OS compatibility.

Installation.comm: Installation wizard on CD does not work.

cont.entity_a: Setup wizard on the supplied CD didn't work with Windows XP; manual configuration was needed.
cont.entity_b: Technical support blamed Windows Vista for installation issues. Installation is difficult without a Linksys router.

cont.entity_a: Router crashes occasionally, requiring at least 2 reboots. Loses connectivity randomly.
cont.entity_b: Wireless security causes spotty connectivity. Works well with wired connection but loses PC audio.

cont.entity_a: No wireless N enabled devices will connect.
cont.entity_b: Not compatible with Windows Vista. Product works with Windows XP only.

cont.entity_a: Good range and works well when operational. Less range than an old Netgear Wireless-G router. Wireless range is limited. Increased wireless range with DD-WRT firmware.

Somewhat buggy firmware; requires rebooting to restore wireless. Firmware issues with NAT and wireless connections. Standard firmware is unreliable, needs daily reboot. Firmware upgrade necessary for certain features.
cont.entity_b: Software gives an annoying dialog when switching audio output. Music Bridge functionality is poor with Vista.

cont.entity_a: Easy setup and fast on host computer.
cont.entity_b: Setup is simple with a wired connection.

cont.entity_a: Easy to use management web interface.
Died after 8 months of use. Used for 5 years before dying.

cont.entity_b: Linksys tech support provides inadequate solutions.
Excellent sound quality when operational. Sound is choppy in wireless mode.

cont.entity_a: Limited USB storage features. Disappointing wireless storage feature.
Administration is similar to older Linksys G routers.
Supports dd-wrt software, adding many great additional features. Functions well with DD-WRT firmware.
Price was $65, but product has connectivity issues.
